content.description:
Start a bit right of

Sand People Cometh

on dark rock. Balance through 5.10 climbing to reach a stance below an orange plaque of rock. From here, continue upward on fun crimps and edges to a mid-anchor (11c).

Move past the sub-anchor, and pull a 12a move to reach a nice crack/corner that takes you to the anchor.
content.location:
Start a bit right of

Sand People Cometh

.

content.description:
Swagga Like Us starts about 60 feet uphill from

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

. Be the boss of the choss for the first couple of bolts as you move up and left towards a long chain draw. Continue onward on the left line of bolts through great stone to the anchor.
content.location:
Start up the hill about 60 feet past

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

.

content.description:
“I know this much is true...”, this is a good 5.11 addition to the Burro. It is a bit harder than Calvin’s and a touch easier than

Appetite for Construction

.

Cross through the bottom choss band on big holds that lead to a leftward series of moves through pockets. Climb up to below a steeper, left-facing corner. Move up and over the overlap into a short, right-facing corner to a variety of finishing holds and the anchor.

Good rests and positive holds are found on this pitch.
content.protection: 12 protection bolts and lowering carabiners at the anchor.
content.location:
Start up and right, 15 feet, of

Appetite for Construction

.

content.description:
Begin with the same start as

Swagga Like Us

, and bust right after the bulge following cruxy moves to a right hand line of bolts.
content.location:
This shares the same start as

Swagga Like Us

and

Boxelder

.

content.description:
This is a harder variation of

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

. Climb past 5 bolts, then go right for a few bolts finishing in the

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

corner.
content.location:
This shares the same start and finish as for

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

.

content.description:
Find a line of bolts 20 feet right of

Swagga

. This is Sand People Cometh. Choss manuevering gets you to a long chain draw and then a nice rest. Engaging climbing all the way to the anchor ensues.

This has really good climbing with a variety of techniques needed to send.
content.location:
It is approximately 20 feet up and right of the

Swagga

start.

content.description:
Start as for

Hollowed Ground

, but veer right at the cactus pod, pulling a bulge with fun pockets.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Hollowed Ground

.

climbs.name: Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

content.description:
This is the first route completed at the Burro Wall.

Climb past 3 bolts with techy and tricky climbing to a stance. Move off the stance and up fantastic rock with fun moves. Finish in a nice corner high above.
content.location:
This route starts about 20 feet right from

Hollowed Ground

.

content.description: The route starts just left of Calvins, the first 3 hangers on Mexican Radio are brown. Trend up and left and after clipping the 4th and 5th bolt, step over a small roof, clip a fixed draw, and onto a beautiful plaque of stone.   Several more bolts protect you through a variety of fun holds to the anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts, 1 perma, and lowering biners at chains.
content.location:
Start the same as

Hollowed Ground

.

climbs.name: Not My Choss To Bare
climbs.fa: Jim Gilchrist and Lynn Sanson, December 2020

content.description:
Make funky moves past the first two bolts of

Doug

, then move up and left on bolts through some fun pockets to a stance below a steeper plaque of stone. Maneuver past two bolts, the crux, after which the angle backs off quickly.

Traddy-like climbing leads up through blocky terrain into a big V corner with 5.9 moves to the anchor. This route is mostly 5.10- climbing and easier except for about 10 feet. Just a few harder moves give the pitch and 11a rating.
content.protection:
Bolts, and bring 14 quickdraws. I recommend stickclipping at least the first if not second bolt of

Doug

to get started. There are lowering carabiners at the anchor.
content.location:
This route starts on the first two bolts of

Doug

. After clipping those bolts, move left, and find some nice pockets leading you up toward the crux. You will be passing below

Beam Me Up, Scotty

and

The Marauders

, both much harder lines.

content.description: Climb a beautiful, orange streak of rock on the left side of the Burro Wall. This has two fun boulder problems separated by a section of tick tacky climbing.
content.location:
Start on the first couple bolts of “

Beam Me Up, Scotty

“. Climb up and left then back right on the overhanging, grey arete!

content.description: After some approach climbing, “La Obsesion“ climbs a bullet plaque of gently overhanging orange and grey rock. This route has a hard boulder problem on crimps and pinches mid pitch. It finishes with a unique tech power corner section. Cold temps and thick skin help with this rig.
content.location:
3 routes left of “

Beam Me Up, Scotty

,”, take the right hand bolt line after the 5th bolt. Then climb straight up orange plaque, going further right at horizontal break is the route “Big Blue”.

content.description:
The first 3 bolts are shared by 2 routes: Hollowed Ground and

Paleo

.

Climb past the 3 bolts with one tricky section, then move up left to a pod with a hidden cactus. Climb through some fun pockets and sidepulls to the anchor.
content.location:
Start about 25 feet uphill from

Doug

.

content.description:
This shares 3 bolts with

Beam Me Up, Scotty

and then veers right into a nice corner with excellent rock.
content.location:
Start with

Beam Me Up, Scotty

, and head right into the corner.

content.description:
Climb first 5 bolts of “

La Obsesion

,“ then head left. Pull over a short bulge into a beautiful, right-facing corner. There are many micro-cruxes on this tour de tech. This is one of the few Burro Wall routes that climbs all the way to the rim. This was an abandoned project of Sanson, and Gross. Achey’s rigging mastery shines on this climb!
content.location: Currently it is the farthest left route at the Burro Wall. Take a short spur trail left 150 feet before reaching main Burro/ base of the slab zone.

content.description:
The route starts up a left-trending groove with a typical chossy start. Stickclip the 2nd bolt. The rock improves as you climb past some finger pods up to a stance above a flaky band. Maneuver up and left into fun corners with tricky footwork.

Find a good rest below the final crux section. Flakes and techy feet get you to a bit of a dynamic throw to a big rail. From the rail, work up and right to the a stance, and clip the anchor.

Fairly sustained and engaging climbing make this route seem a bit longer than 90 feet.
content.protection: 12 protection bolts and lowering hooks at the anchor.
content.location:
The route starts just uphill from

Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins

at a flat spot behind a bush. It ultimately parallels the upper section of

Princeton Girl

- those bolts out to your left.

content.description:
Start as for

Swagga Like Us

, but continue on the plumb line through fun movement and rock features. This is probably the best line at the crag. The crux is pulling through a bulge above the long chain draw, but it remains sustained throughout.
content.protection: 10 Bolts, 3 permas,  chains with lowering biners.
content.location:
Begin with the same start as

Swagga Like Us

.

content.description:
Climb “

La Obsesion

“ to its 7th bolt. Bust right, and climb a steep corner with a V4 boulder problem. Hang on for a final boulder problem culminating with a tech power crux. It joins  “

La Obsesion

” for its last 2 bolts, climbing out right, before heading to the anchor.
content.location: Start on the farthest left bolted start at the Burro Wall.

content.description: This is moderate until it's not, then it's on you. A slightly overhanging arete takes you to the chains.
content.protection: Bolts to chains and lowering biners.
content.location: It is the leftmost line at the Burro Wall proper.

content.description: This is a fun pitch that starts less-than-vertical on a fun variety of holds. After bolt 4, tackle a steeper crack/corner that leads to pockets and crimps through overhanging terrain to the anchor.
content.location:
This route starts 100 feet uphill from the start of

Sweet Choss...

. The first 3 bolts are glue-ins.
